verses.verse: Who is as the wise <S%H2450><s%> man? and who knoweth <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8802><s%> the interpretation <S%H6592><s%> of a thing <S%H1697><s%>? a man's <S%H120><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%> maketh his face <S%H6440><s%> to shine <S%H215><s%> <S%H8686><s%>, and the boldness <S%H5797><s%> of his face <S%H6440><s%> shall be changed <S%H8132><s%> <S%H8792><s%>.
I counsel thee to keep <S%H8104><s%> <S%H8798><s%> the king's <S%H4428><s%> Mitzvah <S%H6310><s%>, and that in regard <S%H1700><s%> of the oath <S%H7621><s%> of 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>.

Be not hasty <S%H926><s%> <S%H8735><s%> to go out <S%H3212><s%> <S%H8799><s%> of his sight <S%H6440><s%>: stand <S%H5975><s%> <S%H8799><s%> not in an evil <S%H7451><s%> thing <S%H1697><s%>; for he doeth <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8799><s%> whatsoever pleaseht <S%H2654><s%> <S%H8799><s%> him.
Where the word <S%H1697><s%> of a king <S%H4428><s%> is, there is power <S%H7983><s%>: and who may say <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%> unto him, What doest <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8799><s%> thou?

Whoso keepeth <S%H8104><s%> <S%H8802><s%> the Mitzvah <S%H4687><s%> shall feel <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8799><s%> no evil <S%H7451><s%> thing <S%H1697><s%>: and a wise man's <S%H2450><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%> discerneth <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8799><s%> both time <S%H6256><s%> and judgment <S%H4941><s%>.
Because to every purpose <S%H2656><s%> there is <S%H3426><s%> time <S%H6256><s%> and judgment <S%H4941><s%>, therefore the misery <S%H7451><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> is great <S%H7227><s%> upon him.
For he knoweth <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8802><s%> not that which shall be: for who can tell <S%H5046><s%> <S%H8686><s%> him when it shall be?

There is no man <S%H120><s%> that hath power <S%H7989><s%> over the spirit <S%H7307><s%> to retain <S%H3607><s%> <S%H8800><s%> the spirit <S%H7307><s%>; neither hath he power <S%H7983><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of death <S%H4194><s%>: and there is no discharge <S%H4917><s%> in that war <S%H4421><s%>; neither shall wickedness <S%H7562><s%> deliver <S%H4422><s%> <S%H8762><s%> those that are given <S%H1167><s%> to it.

All this have I seen <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, and applied <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8800><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> unto every work <S%H4639><s%> that is done <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8738><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>: there is a time <S%H6256><s%> wherein one man <S%H120><s%> ruleth <S%H7980><s%> <S%H8804><s%> over another to his own hurt <S%H7451><s%>.

And so <S%H3651><s%> I saw <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8804><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> buried <S%H6912><s%> <S%H8803><s%>, who had come <S%H935><s%> <S%H8804><s%> and gone <S%H1980><s%> <S%H8762><s%> from the place <S%H4725><s%> of the holy <S%H6918><s%>, and they were forgotten <S%H7911><s%> <S%H8691><s%> in the city <S%H5892><s%> where they had so done <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8804><s%>: this is also vanity <S%H1892><s%>.

Because sentence <S%H6599><s%> against an evil <S%H7451><s%> work <S%H4639><s%> is not executed <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8738><s%> speedily <S%H4120><s%>, therefore the heart <S%H3820><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%> is fully set <S%H4390><s%> <S%H8804><s%> in them to do <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8800><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%>.

Though a sinner <S%H2398><s%> <S%H8802><s%> do <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8802><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> an hundred times <S%H3967><s%>, and his days be prolonged <S%H748><s%> <S%H8688><s%>, yet surely I know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8802><s%> that it shall be well <S%H2896><s%> with them that fear <S%H3373><s%> 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>, which fear <S%H3372><s%> <S%H8799><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> him:

But it shall not be well <S%H2896><s%> with the wicked <S%H7563><s%>, neither shall he prolong <S%H748><s%> <S%H8686><s%> his days <S%H3117><s%>, which are as a shadow <S%H6738><s%>; because he feareth <S%H3373><s%> not before <S%H6440><s%> 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>.

There is <S%H3426><s%> a vanity <S%H1892><s%> which is done <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8738><s%> upon the earth <S%H776><s%>; that there be just <S%H6662><s%> men, unto whom it happeneth <S%H5060><s%> <S%H8688><s%> according to the work <S%H4639><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%>; again, there be <S%H3426><s%> wicked <S%H7563><s%> men, to whom it happeneth <S%H5060><s%> <S%H8688><s%> according to the work <S%H4639><s%> of the righteous <S%H6662><s%>: I said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8804><s%> that this also <S%H1571><s%> is vanity <S%H1892><s%>.

Then I commended <S%H7623><s%> <S%H8765><s%> mirth <S%H8057><s%>, because a man <S%H120><s%> hath no better thing <S%H2896><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>, than to eat <S%H398><s%> <S%H8800><s%>, and to drink <S%H8354><s%> <S%H8800><s%>, and to be merry <S%H8055><s%> <S%H8800><s%>: for that shall abide <S%H3867><s%> <S%H8799><s%> with him of his labour <S%H5999><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of his life <S%H2416><s%>, which 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> giveth <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8804><s%> him under the sun <S%H8121><s%>.

When I applied <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8804><s%> mine heart <S%H3820><s%> to know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8800><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%>, and to see <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8800><s%> the business <S%H6045><s%> that is done <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8738><s%> upon the earth <S%H776><s%>: (for also there is that neither day <S%H3117><s%> nor night <S%H3915><s%> seeth <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8802><s%> sleep <S%H8142><s%> with his eyes <S%H5869><s%>:)

Then I beheld <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8804><s%> all the work <S%H4639><s%> of 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>, that a man <S%H120><s%> cannot <S%H3201><s%> <S%H8799><s%> find out <S%H4672><s%> <S%H8800><s%> the work <S%H4639><s%> that is done <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8738><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>: because <S%H834><s%> though <S%H7945><s%> a man <S%H120><s%> labour <S%H5998><s%> <S%H8799><s%> to seek it out <S%H1245><s%> <S%H8763><s%>, yet he shall not find <S%H4672><s%> <S%H8799><s%> it; yea further; though a wise <S%H2450><s%> man think <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%> to know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8800><s%> it, yet shall he not be able <S%H3201><s%> <S%H8799><s%> to find <S%H4672><s%> <S%H8800><s%> it.
